title: David Mourns Saul and Jonathan
summary: David learns of Saul and Jonathan’s deaths from an Amalekite who falsely claims to have killed Saul. David mourns deeply and executes the man for striking down the Lord’s anointed. He composes a lament honoring both Saul and Jonathan.

faq.question: How did David respond to Saul’s death?
faq.answer: With deep mourning and a public lament honoring Saul and Jonathan.

faq.question: Why was the Amalekite executed?
faq.answer: Because he claimed to have killed Saul, the Lord’s anointed.
